Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Panoramic \Pan`o*ram"ic\, Panoramical \Pan`o*ram"ic*al\, a. 1. Of, pertaining to, or like, a panorama; exhibiting a very broad view; as, a panoramic view. [1913 Webster]
{Panoramic camera}. See under {Camera}. [1913 Webster]
2. Hence: Presented with a broad perspective; as, a panoramic view of European history. [PJC]
panoramic adj : as from an altitude or distance; "a bird's-eye survey"; "a panoramic view" [syn: {bird's-eye}]
